thread.title: Detroit Pistons, current and former, grieve Flip Saunders' death
thread.title_full: Detroit Pistons, current and former, grieve Flip Saunders' death

author: freep.com
title: Detroit Pistons, current and former, grieve Flip Saunders' death
text:
MORE Flip Saunders coached the Detroit Pistons to three consecutive Eastern Conference finals berths in his three years as head coach from 2005-08.
He also left a lasting impression on many of the players who previously helped lead the Pistons to the 2004 NBA championship.
The team expressed its condolences this afternoon following the news that Saunders passed away after a battle with Hodgkin's Lymphoma at age 60.
‚ÄúIt is with tremendous sorrow that the Detroit Pistons organization acknowledges the passing of Flip Saunders," the team said in a statement. "He will be remembered by Pistons fans as one of the franchise‚Äôs most successful head coaches - leading the club to three consecutive Eastern Conference Finals appearances and a franchise-record 64 wins in 2005-06. Flip was a great ambassador for the Metro Detroit community and had a positive influence on those who had the opportunity to spend time with him. We send our heartfelt condolences to his wife, Debbie, his children Ryan, Mindy, Rachel, Kimberly and all his friends throughout the extended Detroit Pistons and NBA family."
Saunders finished his 3-year tenure in Detroit with a 176-70 record. The Pistons fired him following a third consecutive elimination in the East finals, in 2008 to the Boston Celtics, who went on to win the NBA title that year.
Saunders was 654-594 (.524 winning percentage) as an NBA head coach, including 47-51 in the postseason (30-21 with the Pistons).
Many current and former players, some of which played for Saunders in Detroit, took to Twitter to express their sorrows.
R.i.p Flip Sanders. You will be truly missed . üôèüèø Still cannot believe it.
A photo posted by Richard Hamilton (@ripcity3232) on Oct 25, 2015 at 11:50am PDT
NBA has been blessed by your wonderful life, RIP Coach Flip. You will be deeply missed.
‚Äî Rick Mahorn (@badboyhorn44) October 25, 2015 #RIP Flip Saunders #GoneToSoon .
‚Äî Isiah Thomas (@iamisiahthomas) October 25, 2015 My prayers goes out to #coachFlipSaunders family. This was a good man and a great coach. The @Timberwolves family will miss this man.
‚Äî Corey Maggette (@Corey_Maggette) October 25, 2015 RIP Flip. Thoughts and prayers go out to his family and friends. Gone way to soon.
‚Äî Jonas Jerebko (@JonasJerebko) October 25, 2015 Prayers out to the Saunders family and friends. A sad day for the game #RIPFlip
